header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: The text posits that through specific meditative and imaginative techniques, particularly those associated with Tarot Key 13 (Death), individuals can develop supersensory powers by purifying desire, understanding the nature of change and rebirth, and accessing a universal consciousness of love, peace, and bliss.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 37: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: This lesson introduces the esoteric significance of Tarot Key 13, the Hebrew letter Nun (meaning fish and to propagate), and its connection to the Great Deep/Mother Sea. It recounts a personal meditative experience of a child who, after prayer and self-inquiry, experienced a profound sense of unity and bliss, floating in an infinite ocean of love, peace, and bliss. This experience is linked to developing supersensory awareness and understanding the nature of consciousness. The lesson also delves into the symbolism of Tarot Key 13, emphasizing change, reaping wisdom and understanding from past experiences (karma), and the role of the subconscious (moon) in this process. It highlights the concept of purified desire, the electromagnetic interchange in union, and the idea of death as a rebirth, crucial for spiritual evolution. The practical technique for Key 13 involves visualizing the Tarot imagery to embrace change and purification.

key_concepts.definition: Symbolizing the primal, cosmic womb and source of all existence, where propagation (both physical and spiritual) occurs. It is the fluidic substance of love, peace, and bliss.

Assigned to Tarot Key 13, it signifies 'fish' (representing propagation and life within the Great Deep) and also means 'to propagate' as a verb. It embodies the generative and life-sustaining aspects of the divine feminine.

The faculty associated with Tarot Key 13 that allows one to project possibilities and experience wonderful, lovely outcomes. It is a key tool for transcending current limitations and realizing potential.

Represented in Tarot Key 13 by the man and woman. The Cosmic Female is Qabalistically linked to Understanding, and the Cosmic Male to Wisdom. Experiences, even misuses, yield understanding and wisdom.
The central theme of Tarot Key 13. It signifies death to the former situation and rebirth into a new one, leading to the reaping of rewards such as purified desire, wisdom, and understanding.
Not the absence of desire, but desire viewed as holy and beautiful, a drive towards unity and oneness. It is desire seen with the eyes of beauty and holiness.

An esoteric concept, mentioned in relation to 'Sex Perfection and Marital Happiness', describing an energetic exchange during intercourse experienced by those emotionally ready to evolve their awareness.
The core principle of Tarot Key 13, where the end of one form or situation is the beginning of another. This cyclical process is essential for spiritual growth and immortality.
The subconscious is closely involved with the energies of Tarot Key 13. Purifying the subconscious is necessary to move forward.

A fundamental principle existing on mental and emotional levels, signifying the interconnectedness of all beings. It is expressed through telepathy and shared emotion, and is ultimately the oneness of God.

Referred to as the reproductive energy and the source of immense driving power. It is emphasized that aspirants should think with beauty and holiness about this energy, rather than solely focusing on physical plane expression.

practical_system.description: The practical system involves utilizing specific Tarot keys (especially Key 13) for meditation and imaginative work. It focuses on purifying desire, understanding the nature of change and transformation, and cultivating a sense of unity and love. The core practice is a form of guided visualization and self-inquiry designed to access a profound state of consciousness characterized by love, peace, and bliss, leading to the development of supersensory awareness and wisdom. The emphasis is on internal work: analyzing one's life, embracing change, and purifying one's consciousness and desire nature.
rituals: Self-inquiry: asking 'Am I glad that I was born?' and contemplating future possibilities.
Visualization: Permeating oneself and aura with blue-green color (Key 13), visualizing the skeleton as the spirit of change, imagining a rising sun sending light and cleansing energy.
Affirmations: Welcoming change, reaping understanding and wisdom, seeing beauty in union, acting properly, being reborn anew.

relevant_quotes.text: As above, so below. The symbolism is exact.
I would find myself floating in the infinite ocean, this strange ocean of the Mother Deep.
I would begin to analyze my life, going over its details, wondering and reaching for an answer I did not get.
My imagination would project possibilities, and these possibilities seemed so wonderful and lovely that I would say, "Yes, in view of that, I am glad that I was born."
I gazed at my hair, my face, my body, my eyes, and I fell completely in love with myself because I was so perfect! I was a miracle of perfection. This overwhelmed me.

Instantly I was changed from a child in my bed, watching the stars, to a consciousness floating in an infinite ocean, but not an ocean like other oceans. It had qualities. It was a fluidic substance made up of love, peace and bliss. In this I floated like a fish in the vast, beginningless, endless ocean of infinity.
It is interesting to find the right angle of approach mentioned by Dr. Case in the lessons on Tarot Key 20, the fourth dimensional consciousness.

The white rose means purified desire. Purified desire is not absence of desire. A man who loves a woman desires her. A woman who loves a man desires him. It means that the desire is looked upon as something holy, something beautiful, something from on high, as a drive to the expression of unity, oneness, with the beloved. The force is seen with the eyes of beauty and holiness--this is the difference.
The skeleton reaps with a scythe that symbolizes the moon. The energy of the moon is closely involved in the functions represented by this key. The moon is the subconsciousness.
Change is the miracle, reaping all of the rewards of purified desire, wisdom and understanding. This will help us to have less fear.

The principle of unity and love is thus expressed. It is expressed wherever we look. Unity is everywhere, no matter how much we seem isolated in our self-consciousness. Unity is always present because God is One with God.

AFFIRMATION: I welcome change in all its forms and aspects. I reap understanding and wisdom. I reap the ability to see the essential beauty in all forms of union. I reap the capacity for proper action; to be forever born anew. The motion of life is the Divine Urge that leads me towards conscious awareness of my immortality.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text provides a bridge between traditional Tarot symbolism (specifically Key 13) and the development of psychic and supersensory abilities through meditative and imaginative practices. It draws upon Qabalistic concepts and internal experiential accounts to offer a path toward spiritual evolution and enhanced consciousness. The emphasis on purified desire and unity connects it to Hermetic and mystical traditions, while the focus on imagination and inner experience aligns with modern magical thought.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Individuals interested in developing psychic abilities, exploring esoteric interpretations of Tarot, and engaging in self-transformation through meditation and conscious imagination. It is particularly relevant for practitioners familiar with or seeking to understand the teachings of Ann Davies and the Rosicrucian tradition (implied by reference to Dr. Case and B.O.T.A.).
